newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka rupee dips on overseas gains by dlr.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka rupee dips on overseas gains by dlr.

text.p: The Sri Lankan rupee fell in early Tuesday trading as banks factored in overseas gains by the greenback, dealers said.
At 0500 GMT the rupee was at 58.64 to the dollar, after opening at 58.65, they said.
"The rupee opened down because banks had factored in overseas gains by the dollar and expected the Central Bank to react accordingly," said an American Express Bank dealer.
The Central Bank pushed up the dollar by 4.75 local cents, fixing buying and selling prices at 58.3506 and 59.5294.
Low call rates also fueled demand for dollars, dealers said.
Overnight call money fell to 9.5 percent, after opening at 12 percent, after a big state lender entered the market, they said.
